synthesis_conditions.solvents: toluene (1 mL for I2 solution, 6 mL for [Pt2(n-pentyl-CS2)4] solution), n-hexane (4 mL)
synthesis_conditions.procedure: I2 solution in toluene added dropwise to [Pt2(n-pentyl-CS2)4] solution in toluene under Ar atmosphere, reduced to 3 mL, added 4 mL n-hexane, kept at 4°C for 24h
synthesis_conditions.washing_method: washed with cold n-hexane (3 x 3 mL)

synthesis_conditions.equipment: Xcalibur diffractometer with an area detector
synthesis_conditions.radiation: graphite monochromated Mo Ka radiation (λ = 0.71069 Å)

synthesis_conditions.procedure: DC electrical conductivity measured with four contacts method, Pt wires and graphite paste used for contacts, measured in Quantum Design PPMS-9 with DC currents 10–100 nA, two sequences of temperature changes used
temperature_sequences: 300 to 100 K then warmed to 300 K
300 to 400 K then cooled to 100 K followed by heating from 100 to 400 K

synthesis_conditions.step: Adsorption of MMX Fibers on Mica
synthesis_conditions.procedure: 1 mg of [Pt2(n-pentylCS2)4I] in 1 mL THF sonicated for 1 h at 30°C, diluted, deposited on freshly exfoliated Muscovite mica, left in air for solvent evaporation

synthesis_conditions.step: Formation of MMX Nanocrystals on Mica
synthesis_conditions.procedure: 1 mg of [Pt2(n-pentylCS2)4I] in 1 mL solvent mixture sonicated for 15 min at 30°C, diluted to 0.1 g L-1, deposited on freshly exfoliated Muscovite mica, left in air for solvent evaporation
Macroscopic gold electrode evaporated on samples at 10-7 mbar, conductive Au/Pd tips prepared by sputtering, AFM used for topographic images and conductance measurements

Ground-state electronic structure obtained via single-point ab initio calculations based on plane-wave ultrasoft-pseudopotential implementation of DFT, PBE generalized gradient approximation used, calculations performed for LT, RT, and HT crystal phases
